column4: wireless apparently remains the great mystery of Ubuntu operating systems
except when it doesn't work, and nobody seems to have an inkling of how to make it work....
most of the times when wireless cards don't work, they're from a crappy closed-source vendor who actively refuses to cooperate with efforts to write Linux wireless drivers.

in my case...the wireless was working fine, had been working fine since Hardy came out, then all of a sudden one day stopped seeing anything...since then, all attempts on here to find out if my card's simply dead or if it's something I can fix have pretty much been met with total silence
